summary: Grand Admiral Thrawn  rumored to be returning in Episode 9? Possible portrayal by Richard E. Grant.
title: Grand Admiral Thrawn  rumored to be returning in Episode 9? Possible portrayal by Richard E. Grant.
body:
For those who do not know, Mitth’raw’nurodo, better known as Thrawn, was a Legends continuity character whom recently just made his official canon appearance on Star Wars: Rebels. There has been speculation about the infamous Imperial Grand Admiral’s return, to the big screen for the first time, in the upcoming final chapter to the Sequel Trilogy, the untitled Episode IX. Rumors suggest that casting for this character is by Richard E. Grant, gained recognition for his portrayal of the character John Steward in Bram Stoker’s Dracula. He has also appeared as the main protagonist in Logan and made an appearance in Game of Thrones.

Here is a short backstory to Thrawn-

Thrawn is a Chiss, an alien race native to the Unknown Regions that, at the time of the Imperial Era, was vast uncharted space. The Galactic Empire was highly xenophobic and was only comprised of Humans, while several alien species were either enslaved or their worlds/governments were used as puppet states holding very little or no powers at all, however, Emperor Palpatine considered Thrawn to be the only exception. Thrawn was known for his brutality that matched the Emperor’s to a certain degree and was an indirect rival of Darth Vader’s. He was a military genius who built a philosophy of understanding his enemie’s philosophies and art. He had risen through the Imperial hierarchy to the status of Grand Admiral and commanded the Seventh Fleet. 

Before he dissapeared, Thrawn’s knowlege of his home system allowed the Imperial Remnants to escape into the Unknown Regions after the Battle of Jakku. To that end, it was Thrawn who made the First Order’s existance a reality.

Given that, Thrawn playing a pivotol role in the First Order’s rise to power and insuring the survival of the New Order, could he make his return in Episode IX? For those who watched Rebels, his fate was left uncertain, so it is possible his return could play an important role in the plot for IX.

Maybe he will not be alone…

title: Kiinkloren
body:
Finn: I can’t believe you and Rey broke the bed.

Rose: Yeah! You two must’ve been wild!

Kylo: haha yeah…

[the night before]

Kylo: I bet you can’t jump high enough to touch the ceiling

Rey: bet

summary: Welp, I am approximately eleventy MILLION years late to the “make Rey’s bracer” party, but here it is!  Me being an obsessive...
caption:
Welp, I am approximately eleventy MILLION years late to the “make Rey’s bracer” party, but here it is!

Me being an obsessive perfectionist, it took the better part of a day to design the pattern – I even had the McCall’s pattern for a jumping-off point, but that turned out to be terrible, like, the layers were badly proportioned, and the smallest it could fit was a 9″ wrist, what the hell, and it wasn’t adjustable at all. I went through about six different paper patterns and three rejected leather prototypes before I settled on  an acceptable final version.

But good news! Now that all that’s out of the way, it turns out they are really quick to make, and I am pleased to be able to offer them for a cool $25 a pop, shipping out basically overnight. They are, in the words of the housemate I was testing them on, “super comfortable!” and will adjust to fit wrists anywhere between 6″-10″. (It’s also reversible, as you can see in the pictures above, which is kind of nifty.)

And because I’d hate for all my effort to go under-utilized, DIY-minded folks are welcome to use my pattern (it is as-or-more-screen-accurate than anything else you’ll find) – or, if you’d like Rey’s bracer in some lovely oil-tan leather that has been waiting for just this occasion, you can check it out at my shop. 😊

title: Jakku Beach
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2v0PMpC

by LostInQueue

Rey Kenobi is a prodigy surfer, exposed in at a dare surfing at fourteen in a competition healed every year, meant for adults, called ‘Mile 5’. She’s swept into fame immediately and in time has to leave Jakku Beach, her home and friends for her safety.

Six years later, her manager, Mrs. Holdo, needs to return to take care of her family, throwing Rey the idea of going back to Jakku, hoping she can pick up where she left off.

Words: 10840, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Star Wars
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: F/M, Gen, Multi
  • Characters: Rey (Star Wars), Ben Solo, Snoke (Star Wars), Luke Skywalker, Rose Tico, Finn (Star Wars), Armitage Hux, Jessika Pava, Kaydel Connix, Poe Dameron
  • Relationships: Rey & Ben Solo, Rey & Rose Tico, Kaydel & Poe Dameron, Snoke & Rey
  • Additional Tags: Jakku Beach, Star Wars TLJ - Freeform, Surfing, Slow Burn, Summer, Fundraiser, Partnership, Love, Lust, Swimming, surfing terms, child endangerment, Assault, Tabloids, Fame, Homecoming, AU, Alternate Universe, life guards, ocean lifeguarding, Coast Guard, competitions, Rivalry

summary: Stars Wars and read these Siege of Mandalore theories
body:
Stars Wars and read these Siege of Mandalore theories

So whether we believe that Korkie is Obitine’s kid or not - we all want him to show up or at least be mentioned in the new season.

Now I have a few ideas…

-he could show up deliverering supplies to whoever, and asks where Obi-Wan is. Either Ahsoka, Rex, or Anakin go “Oh, Obi-Wan/Master/General Kenobi says he’s sorry he can’t make it because ~bullshit~ reason.” Cue Korkie’s bummed face.

Or

“Generals, Commander Kryze is on comm 1.”

“Patch him in, Rex.”

Anakin looks at the young man when his holo fizzles into sight, but before either can say anything-

“Korkie!” General Kenobi exclaims, putting his hand on the imaging table. “"Are you okay? Are your hurt?”

Korkie cracks a tired smile. “Not to bad. Lost my cloak doing something Aunt Bo called ‘reckless.’ Don’t know what she meant by that.”

Anakin glanced between the pair while they talked, and finally raised his eyebrows at his clone captain, a grin forming on his face when they realized the relationship between Obi-Wan and Korkie.

Or

At one point, maybe when Bo-Katan and Ahsoka finally meet the Jedi, someone (Obi-Wan) asks how many have died.

Bo and Ahsoka glance at each other, and the latter takes Anakin, Cody, and Rex into the meeting.

“What? What is it?” Obi-Wan asks, feeling fear coil in his stomach.

“Master - Obi-Wan. It’s not good.”

“Ahsoka please,” Obi-Wan says while they they sit on the cargo boxes, eyes straight ahead. “I think I can handle it.”

Ahsoka sighs, pressing her lips together. “Korkie…his girlfriend was captured by Death Watch. He…went against orders to rescue her.”

Obi-Wan listens to her speak, knowing now why there was a hole in the Force.

“He got her out but…the wounds he sustained…we couldn’t save him, Master Kenobi.

Obi-Wan closes his eyes, letting out a shuddering breath.

Ahsoka’s comlink beeps. She answers it while standing. "What Skyguy?”

“We need your expertise, Snips. Obi-Wan too, if he’s able.”

“Copy that.” Ahsoka glances at the young master - she never really thought about that before, how young he really was - and lays a hand on his shoulder. His face is turned away from her. “I’m sorry, Master Kenobi. I know how much they meant to you.”

Obi-Wan nods, sighing audibly. “Thank you, Ahsoka. I’ll…be along in a moment.”

Ahsoka nods, leaving her other master alone.

(cue a slow shift to Obi-Wan’s face, where we see tears falling down his face. Steady pan outward, and we see him bury his face in his hands. End scene)

And then…

At some point, we see Bo-Katan smuggle him to visit Satine grave, for they have brought Korkie’s body to be buried beside her. We don’t see them burying it, but just before they leave, Obi-Wan carves something into the stone with his lightsaber on Korkie’s grave.

Bo-Katan observes it and smiles before they leave.

We as fans don’t know what it means, but eventually someone cracks the code - Obi-Wan carved “Beloved Son” into the stone.

Thank you for your time. Enjoy the tears.

reblog.comment:
Stars Wars and read these Siege of Mandalore theories

So whether we believe that Korkie is Obitine’s kid or not - we all want him to show up or at least be mentioned in the new season.

Now I have a few ideas…

-he could show up deliverering supplies to whoever, and asks where Obi-Wan is. Either Ahsoka, Rex, or Anakin go “Oh, Obi-Wan/Master/General Kenobi says he’s sorry he can’t make it because ~bullshit~ reason.” Cue Korkie’s bummed face.

Or

“Generals, Commander Kryze is on comm 1.”

“Patch him in, Rex.”

Anakin looks at the young man when his holo fizzles into sight, but before either can say anything-

“Korkie!” General Kenobi exclaims, putting his hand on the imaging table. “"Are you okay? Are your hurt?”

Korkie cracks a tired smile. “Not to bad. Lost my cloak doing something Aunt Bo called ‘reckless.’ Don’t know what she meant by that.”

Anakin glanced between the pair while they talked, and finally raised his eyebrows at his clone captain, a grin forming on his face when they realized the relationship between Obi-Wan and Korkie.

Or

At one point, maybe when Bo-Katan and Ahsoka finally meet the Jedi, someone (Obi-Wan) asks how many have died.

Bo and Ahsoka glance at each other, and the latter takes Anakin, Cody, and Rex into the meeting.

“What? What is it?” Obi-Wan asks, feeling fear coil in his stomach.

“Master - Obi-Wan. It’s not good.”

“Ahsoka please,” Obi-Wan says while they they sit on the cargo boxes, eyes straight ahead. “I think I can handle it.”

Ahsoka sighs, pressing her lips together. “Korkie…his girlfriend was captured by Death Watch. He…went against orders to rescue her.”

Obi-Wan listens to her speak, knowing now why there was a hole in the Force.

“He got her out but…the wounds he sustained…we couldn’t save him, Master Kenobi.

Obi-Wan closes his eyes, letting out a shuddering breath.

Ahsoka’s comlink beeps. She answers it while standing. "What Skyguy?”

“We need your expertise, Snips. Obi-Wan too, if he’s able.”

“Copy that.” Ahsoka glances at the young master - she never really thought about that before, how young he really was - and lays a hand on his shoulder. His face is turned away from her. “I’m sorry, Master Kenobi. I know how much they meant to you.”

Obi-Wan nods, sighing audibly. “Thank you, Ahsoka. I’ll…be along in a moment.”

Ahsoka nods, leaving her other master alone.

(cue a slow shift to Obi-Wan’s face, where we see tears falling down his face. Steady pan outward, and we see him bury his face in his hands. End scene)

And then…

At some point, we see Bo-Katan smuggle him to visit Satine grave, for they have brought Korkie’s body to be buried beside her. We don’t see them burying it, but just before they leave, Obi-Wan carves something into the stone with his lightsaber on Korkie’s grave.

Bo-Katan observes it and smiles before they leave.

We as fans don’t know what it means, but eventually someone cracks the code - Obi-Wan carved “Beloved Son” into the stone.

Thank you for your time. Enjoy the tears.
